Aeromicrobium alkaliterrae is able to utilize a variety of carbohydrates as carbon sources for growth, including glucose, fructose, and sucrose. It is also capable of hydrolyzing starch and casein, suggesting its involvement in the degradation of complex organic compounds in its natural habitat.

Phylogenetic analysis based on 16S rRNA gene sequences has shown that Aeromicrobium alkaliterrae is closely related to other Aeromicrobium species, which are commonly found in soil and aquatic environments.
